summary: More than 1.7 million injuries and 83,000 deaths over a recent 10-year period in the U.S. have been potentially linked to faulty medical devices. These medical products range from surgical masks to implantable pacemakers. FDA has begun building a surveillance system to look for potential safety issues in such devices. It plans to start with a few devices and expand over time. However, it has...
title: Medical Devices: FDA Has Begun Building an Active Postmarket Surveillance System
